bug.author: crauterb
bug.summary: Istio-Gateway for created Notebook Servers is not configurable
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: I deployed v0.6.1. of Kubeflow in an existing Kubernetes Cluster with an existing Istio-Setup. After adapting all virtual-service definitions, I got stuck on deploying new notebooks: I was not able to configure the created virtual service for the created notebook server. The default version that is deployed is: apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1alpha3 kind: VirtualService metadata: name: notebook-kubeflow-my-jupyter spec: gateways: - kubeflow/kubeflow-gateway hosts: - '*' http: - match: - uri: prefix: /notebook/kubeflow/my-jupyter rewrite: uri: /notebook/kubeflow/my-jupyter route: - destination: host: my-jupyter.kubeflow.svc.cluster.local port: number: 80 timeout: 300s ... and if I am not mistaken, this is hard-coded in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/components/notebook-controller/pkg/controller/notebook/notebook_controller.go#L431>notebook-controller.go</denchmark-link>
What did you expect to happen: I expected to be able to configure the gateway using a .yaml file or environment variable. Anything else you would like to add: I generated the configuration using <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-existing-arrikto/>this documentation</denchmark-link> . Environment:
Kubeflow version: : v.0.6.1 kfctl version: : v0.6.1-rc.2-1-g3a37cbc6 Kubernetes platform: on-premise Kubernetes cluster Kubernetes client version: (use kubectl version): v1.15.2 Kubernetes server version: (use kubectl version): v1.11.3 OS: Ubuntu

Seems like a limitation of the notebook controller. Possible solution:
Add option in notebook controller to define the Istio Gateway. Expose that option as a parameter in kubeflow/manifests. Set that parameter to your desired value in the KfDef config file.
applications: - name: notebook-controller kustomizeConfig: overlays: - istio - application parameters: - name: istio-gateway value: mygateway repoRef: name: manifests path: jupyter/notebook-controller /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link>
